text:
And advice for getting a global JS file to load before module JS? I’m trying to get my global JS file to be the first thing loaded, but it seems like I’ve tried every combination of async/defer/position: ‘head’/position: ‘footer’ for the JS file and their module `require_js` portions, but the module JS always logs first. I have the global JS file imported near the top of my base template’s `<head>`:
```{{ require_js(get_asset_url('../../static/js/test.js'), { type: 'module' } )}}```

Is there a template variable available that will give me the hash/anchor link in a url? e.g. <http://example.com/page#anchor-link|example.com/page#anchor-link> I've looked in "Developer info" on my page, but the hash does not remain part of the url in the developer info and thus no hash to find.

No. You could use JS, of course. But to access it with HubL, you would need to use a query parameter, i.e. `/page?anchor=hello` I don’t know if that would make sense with what you’re trying to do, but I’m pretty confident there’s no other way.
Ah, bummer. Kind of what  I was thinking.
